titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Peter Goss interview with Norman Hill audio recording 1983 May 10
Goss (Peter) interview with Norman Hill audio recording
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Christopher Drew.

did.unittitle: Peter Goss interview with Norman Hill audio recording
did.abstract: The Peter Goss interview with Norman Hill audio recording (1983) covers the career of architect Norman Hill, an engineer and former associate of Frank Lloyd Wright and Taylor Woolley. Goss is a professor of architectural history at the University of Utah.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Peter L. Goss, Ph.D. (b. 1943) is a professor of architectural history and associate vice president for scholarly and creative activities at the University of Utah. His specialties include the Arts and Crafts Movement, American Suburbia, Utah architecture, the vernacular architecture of the American West, and the Prairie School architecture of Frank Lloyd Wright, which was popularized in Utah in part by Wright's associate, Utah architect Taylor Woolley.
Norman Hill was an engineer who worked with Wright and Woolley.

scopecontent.p: The Peter Goss interview with Norman Hill audio recording (1983) covers the career of architect Norman Hill, an engineer and former associate of Frank Lloyd Wright and Taylor Woolley.

accessrestrict.p: Materials must be used on-site; no use of original material, access copies will be made available for viewing. Five business days advanced notice required. Access to parts of this collection may be restricted under provisions of state or federal law, condition of the material, or by donor.

relatedmaterial.p: Peter Goss also contributed photographs to the University of Utah archives photographs collection (P0305).

scopecontent.p: A retired engineer, Hill offers a brief biographical sketch, highlighting his experience at Taliesin under Frank Lloyd Wright and his association with Taylor Woolley, a Utah architect who worked with Wright in the early 1900s and contributed to the spread of the famous architect's low, "prairie style" architecture in Utah. The interview was conducted by Edmund Barlow at Hill's residence in Salt Lake City, Utah.
